page.title: 05THE EDAY FREE STONE QUARRY
page.content: The free stone quarry was in use on the West Side for over 100 years. People took stone out of the quarry either for their own use or for export to other islands and the mainland of Orkney. The quarry opens on to the shore so it was quite easy to get the stone to the boats. The stone was taken out with picks, put onto trolleys which ran along tracks to the small jetty. The stone that came out of the quarry was red sandstone. The stone was used for building purposes, much of the stone used in the building of St. Magnus Cathedral in Kirkwall was from Eday. The quarry is no longer worked as it became too expensive to transport the stone to other islands.
